movie_title: 9 Ways to Design Your Life Like a Stoic Philosopher | Ryan Holiday
introduction: ðŸ“– Preoder the final book in Ryan Holiday's Stoic Virtues Series: https://store.dailystoic.com/pages

vocabulary.definition: a person who can endure pain or hardship without showing their feelings or complaining
vocabulary.example: The stoic man faced the loss of his job with silent acceptance.

vocabulary.definition: a state of anxiety or nervous excitement
vocabulary.example: Her agitation grew as the deadline for the project approached.

vocabulary.definition: to strengthen or invigorate mentally or physically
vocabulary.example: She drank a nutritious smoothie to fortify herself before the marathon.

vocabulary.definition: to increase or add to something, especially when it already has been increased or added to
vocabulary.example: The interest on the investment compounds annually, leading to significant growth over time.

vocabulary.definition: to delay or postpone action; put off doing something
vocabulary.example: I tend to procrastinate on tasks that I find challenging.

vocabulary.definition: the quality of being without a clear shape or form
vocabulary.example: In martial arts, practitioners learn to move with formlessness to adapt to any situation.
